Announcing Speedometer 3.0: A Shared Browser Benchmark for Web Application Responsiveness â€” Speedometer has been around since 2014, but this new 3.0 release is the first with a new cross-industry collaborative approach that's supported by each major browser engine (Blink, Gecko, WebKit). Version 3 adds many new tests, performance wins, and improvements. The WebKit team call it the â€œbest way yet to measure browserÂ performanceâ€.

Apple, Google, Microsoft, and Mozilla

Handling Videos? Here's the Only Video API You'll Ever Need â€” Transform videos in real-time with URL-based parameters, leverage adaptive bitrate streaming, and deliver optimized videos across the globe. Effortlessly personalize the visual experience for your users; don't take our word; Try ImageKitÂ Today.

ImageKit.io sponsor

Interaction to Next Paint is Now Officially a Core Web Vital â€” It has now replaced First Input Delay. Hereâ€™s a quick recap of whatâ€™s now changed along with some resources to help you find and fix INPÂ issues.

Rick Viscomi (Google)

The Quiet, Pervasive Devaluation of Frontend â€” Considered introspection here on the discernment of the frontend trade as a whole: â€œI feel like Iâ€™m seeing a widespread diminishment of the practice of frontend. [..] I notice its importance minimized, and its challengesÂ trivialized.â€

Josh Collinsworth

âš¡ï¸ Quick Links

  • ğŸ¦ The Brave browser has enjoyed hockey stick install growth following browser choice screens being added to iOS in the EU.

  • ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Yet more EU/Apple tinkering: certain devs in the EU will be able to distribute apps directly from webpages, although it's a tad drawn out.

  • ğŸŒ 35 years ago, in March 1989 Sir Tim Berners-Lee wrote â€œInformation Management: A Proposalâ€ outlining the World Wide Web.

  • ğŸ–¼ï¸ You probably don't want to use "double quotes" in alt attribute text.

Michelle Barker

Chris Haynes

CSS Variable Groups â€” A proposed way to define multiple properties under the same namespace and pass the entire group around, addressing several pain points around design tokens, design systems, and integrating third-party components. Lea notes that it has been shared with the CSS WorkingÂ Group.

Lea Verou

Best Practices For OAuth In Mobile Apps â€” Master the art of secure logins: Where OAuth meets native apps, simplicity shakes hands withÂ security.

FusionAuth sponsor

Bas Schouten

Improvements to the Speculation Rules API â€” A look over the latest updates to the experimental Speculation Rules API â€” designed to improve performance for future navigations. These include document rules, eagerness setting, limits, and platformÂ support.

Barry Pollard (Chrome for Developers)

'Jakob Has Jumped the Shark'? â€” Itâ€™s fair to say Jakob Nielsenâ€™s latest rumination on generative UI has caused plenty of chatter, as this collection of responsesÂ shows.

Adrian Roselli

Vitaly Friedman

â–¶Â Â How to Create an Animated, Circular Progress Bar
Kevin Powell

Capo.js: A Five Minute Web Performance Boost? â€” Dave quips that this tool can offer a five minute web performance win thatâ€™s â€œsure to get you a promotionâ€ ğŸ˜‰. The tool in question? Itâ€™s Capo.js â€”Â designed to help you get the elements in your <head> in order, hopefully resulting in perfÂ gains.

Dave Rupert

This is WCAG: A Free Resource to Help You Build Inclusive Web Experiences â€” Includes 80+ tests that you can filter by conformance level and different accessibility categories. Also offers brief explanations so you can better understand the meaning of each accessibilityÂ criterion.

canaxess

Transformational Auth & Identity | Userfront â€” Userfront is an auth & identity platform that transforms your business to serve free, freemium and enterpriseÂ customers.

Userfront sponsor

Expressive Code: An Engine for Presenting Source Code on the Web â€” Sort of like a syntax highlighter on steroids, this gives you some extra flexibility, allowing customizations like editor/terminal frames, text/line markers, collapsible sections, andÂ more.

Expressive Code

Finder 3.2: CSS Selector Generator â€” Given an element, it produces the shortest possible selector that reaches (solely) thatÂ element.

items.title: A week is a long time in web development
items.content:
âœï¸ Your usual editor, Chris, is currently busy braving the crowds at Disneyland Paris, so I'm stepping into his shoes â€“ just in case you notice a slight difference to the style of this issue ;-) Chris will be back â€“ a little grayer â€“ nextÂ week..Â ğŸ˜…
__
Your other editor, Peter Cooper

ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹633 â€” March 6, 2024 | Read on the web

PixiJS v8: Build Striking 2D WebGL Experiences â€” PixiJS is a very mature, long standing rendering library that abstracts away the pain of building fast 2D graphical experiences for the Web. v8 boasts significant performance improvements, a WebGPU-backed renderer, and a variety of API improvements. If youâ€™re new to Pixi, thereâ€™s an interactiveÂ tutorial.

PixiJS Team

Apple Reverses Course on 'Death' of Progressive Web Apps in EU â€” For the past couple of weeks, weâ€™ve focused on the recent, worrying developments of Apple dropping support for PWAs in iOS as a part of complying with EU regulations, but a week is a long time in the world of Web development, and Apple has â€œreversed course because of numerous requests by consumers to keep the feature.â€ Thatâ€™s one way to putÂ it!

Apple Insider

ğŸ§© Build Your Products 8.6x Faster. Put FrontEnd on Autopilot â€” Customize and theme React templates or drag & drop components coming from top open-source libraries like MUI, Tailwind UI, and more. Need more headstart? Generate UI with AI. When youâ€™re done, just copy the production-ready code off theÂ design.

UXPin Merge sponsor

WebKit Features in Safari 17.4 â€” Just like Safari 15.4 and 16.4, Safari 17.4 is a significant update for developers targeting users across the board, whether on desktop, phones, tablets, or even Vision Pro. CSS Scoping is a big step, there are improvements to white space and text wrapping properties, and we get support for percentages in letter-spacing and word-spacing.

Jen Simmons and Jon Davis (WebKit)

Safari Switching It Up with.. an HTML Switch Control â€” â€œWeâ€™re very excited to introduce a new HTML form control as part of Safari 17.4: a switch.â€ Essentially, it slots in as a more Apple-y variant of aÂ checkbox.

Anne van Kesteren and Jon Davis (WebKit)

âš¡ï¸ Quick Links

  • Long time blogger Jason Kottke has shaken things up with a big '2024 vibes' redesign of his popular blog. You might also enjoy this look at his previous designs stretching back toÂ 1998.

  • Remember when Chris Coyier sold CSS Tricks to Digital Ocean? It turns out he later asked them to give it back to him.

  • Google has made a variety of updates to its search indexing approach to tackle things like expired domain abuse, the generation of large numbers of automated pages, and certain types of third-party content on other sites.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Modern CSS Tooltips and Speech Bubbles â€” Everyone knows what tooltips are, but despite their ubiquity, thereâ€™s no single, universal way to create them. The author of this post presents some modern techniques to create tooltips with the smallest amount of markup while retaining the mostÂ flexibility.

Temani Afif

Will Boyd
